image.altText: Travis Head fumbles the ball as he dives forward on the ground comically

items.synopsis: Zak Crawley falls for 61 in the last over before lunch at the end of a fast-scoring opening session of the Ashes at Edgbaston.Â Follow all the action from day one in our live blog.

title.children: Aussie bowlers up for the challenge as England attacks on day one of the Ashes

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: England have scored 124 runs in that session, but with that third wicket, has Australia edged the session? England have been scoring at a rate of knots, but we knew that they would and on a lifeless, dead pitch that's a great outcome for me.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Lunch: England 3-124 (Root 20)

children.content: England have scored 124 runs in that session, but with that third wicket, has Australia edged the session?
England have been scoring at a rate of knots, but we knew that they would and on a lifeless, dead pitch that's a great outcome for me.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: That's a terrible decision from Marais Erasmus! That ball has clattered into Crawley's thumb and he has to go for 61 off 73 balls. What did he not see? "Are you walking?" says Erasmus, incredibly, to Crawley, who considering he did not walk when he edged one on 40 is hardly likely to comply now. The right outcome was made in the end, at least.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: OUT! Crawley has to go on the stroke of lunch!

children.content: That's a terrible decision from Marais Erasmus!
That ball has clattered into Crawley's thumb and he has to go for 61 off 73 balls.
"Are you walking?" says Erasmus, incredibly, to Crawley, who considering he did not walk when he edged one on 40 is hardly likely to comply now.
The right outcome was made in the end, at least.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Overturned on review! Dean thought it was pitching outside leg, and so did everyone except the Aussies, who were right! A big wicket for Australia! Pope is out for 31 off 44. Great bowling from Nathan Lyon, who is getting a bit of turn here, just enough in fact, to get the wicket.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: OUT! Ollie Pope is out! Nathan Lyon strikes!

children.content: Dean thought it was pitching outside leg, and so did everyone except the Aussies, who were right!
Great bowling from Nathan Lyon, who is getting a bit of turn here, just enough in fact, to get the wicket.

image.altText: Liberal Senator David Van
